101.description: Represents the amount of physical currency (cash) that the organization has on hand.

102.description: Represents the amount of money the organization has in its bank accounts.

103.description: For recording the value of physical assets like land, buildings, and equipment that the organization owns for its operations.

104.description: Represents the accumulated depreciation on properties and equipment.

105.description: For recording amounts owed to the organization by others in the form of promissory notes or bills.

106.description: For recording amounts owed to the organization by others that don't fall into the category of bills receivables.

107.description: A contra-asset account representing the estimated amount that may not be collected from accounts receivable due to probable losses.

201.description: Represents the liability the organization owes to its members for their micro-savings. Damayan contributions are recorded here as well.

202.description: Represents the amounts the organization owes to its creditors.

203.description: For recording amounts the organization owes in the form of written promissory notes.

204.description: For recording amounts the organization owes for utility services.

205.description: Represents taxes that the organization owes but has not yet paid.

206.description: Represents payments made by members in advance.

207.description: Represents collections and payments made for the death benefits assistance disbursement of members.

208.description: Represents excess payments made by members which should be debited on the next billing.

301.description: Represents the contributions of the organization's members to its capital parti.

302.description: Represents the organization's cumulative net income.

303.description: Represents amounts the organization owes to its members for various payments.

304.account_name: DUE TO EQUITY - FUND TRANSFER (TO/FROM OTHER POWAS)
304.alias: DUE TO EQUITY - FUND TRANSFER (TO/FROM OTHER POWAS)
304.description: Represents amounts the organization owes or is owed in the context of fund transfers with other organizations.

305.description: Represents refunds owed to the organization's members.

401.description: Represents the total revenue earned from receivables.

402.description: Represents revenue from fees charged for application processes.

404.description: Represents revenue from fees charged for reconnection of services.

407.description: A contra-revenue account representing the amount of rebates and discounts given.

408.description: Represents revenue from collecting past-due amounts.

501.description: Represents expenses related to supplies and materials purchased. Includes PVC pipes, water meters, couplings, connectors, adapters, etc.

502.description: Represents allowances paid to meter installers.

503.description: Represents allowances paid to collectors, meter readers, and tank cleaners.

504.description: Represents expenses related to taxes and licenses.

505.description: Represents expenses related to office supplies and printing.

506.description: Represents expenses related to utility services.

507.description: Represents expenses related to honoraria for officers.

508.description: Represents expenses related to repairing and maintaining assets.

509.description: Represents expenses related to donations and cash gifts.

512.description: Represents the allocation of the cost of tangible assets over their useful lives.
